page.title: 02Gilling-Wass Gap Farming
page.content: The main products are pasture, dairy cattle, sheep and beef. Next come barley and wheat then oil seed rape and some peas and potatoes. The valley was once an oak swamp (the Hambleton hills on the north side are limestone and drain into the valley) but the area has been artificially drained and improved to make it more fertile. On the Ministry of Agriculture scale most of the land is grade 3 (on the south side) with some grade 2 in the west. The many steeper areas are wooded and are grade five. Distribution is now generally through merchants to big firms and wholesale butchers. Some pigs, sheep and dairy cattle are sold locally in Malton, Thirsk and York. Generally farming is mixed. There is a sense of tradition in the farming, although methods are as progressive as anywhere.
